intro: Brewcaria duidensis, commonly known as the Duidens Island morning glory, is a flowering plant native to the Galápagos Islands. It belongs to the Convolvulaceae family, which includes many species of vines and herbs. The plant is characterized by its trumpet-shaped, showy flowers that typically bloom in the morning. Its leaves are heart-shaped and have a velvety texture, while its stems are twining and can climb other vegetation. Brewcaria duidensis is adapted to the unique ecological conditions of its island habitat, making it an important component of the local flora.
